unitName: Myth and meaning in ancient worlds
description: Mythic narrative provides a crucial vision of reality and discusses ideas about life, death, sexuality, culture, transcendence, etc. Students will learn about myth and symbol, types and functions of myths, and different approaches to myth interpretation through reading mythic narratives from ancient sources and classical texts from ancient Mediterranean cultures. The unit also looks at re-interpretation of ancient myths within the Hebrew Bible and early Christian writings and their relevance in the modern age. The unit will be of relevance to students majoring in any branch of historical, literary and religion studies.
